column4: Hey. I'm trying to install a package through apt-get with no mirrors in /etc/apt/sources.list. What I have done is to move my <filename>.deb into /var/cache/apt and try to do 'apt-get install <filename>'. But that aint working, what else is required to be done?
then I need to do dpkg like 10 times in correct order, isnt it much easier to just move shit to a folder, and hit apt-get install?
apt-get cannot directly install debs, you need a local-repo
but apt-get uses dl'ed files, right?
run.sh: line 4: aptitude: command not found
gnome + some hacking, i guess 16gb ram is enough? :p
you always could add swapfiles if you really need swap
only limitation is, that hibernation fails without swap-partition
the box boots in like 21 seconds from I press power.
